entry.dcterms:title: TÁRKI Omnibus 2001/4. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.
entry.dcterms:creator: Zsadányi-Nagy, Csaba
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-E57: TÁRKI Omnibus 2001/4. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.. data sheet. Version: 2007-01-19
entry.dcterms:creator: 1. Gazsó, Tibor
2. Róbert, Péter
2. Tóth, István György
2. Tóth, Zsolt
entry.dcterms:description: 1) party preferences, popularity of politicians, evaluation of the work of the government and opposition, subjective financial situation, evaluating the economic situation of Hungary, opinion about the governments after the regime change 2) health of respondents and their family members, datosfaction with the received healt care services, opinion about the increased government control over hospitals, willingness to take risks
entry.dcterms:subject: economic conditions and indicators
income, property and savings
mass political behavior, attitudes
health care and medical treatment
demography
political institutions, public administration
health condition
person
survey data
cross-section

A multi-stage proportionally stratified random probability sample representative of the Hungarian adult population. Unsuccessful inquiries were substituted with supplementary addresses, where persons to be interviewed were selected on the basis of the Leslie Kish key.
face-to-face interview
A
entry.dcterms:rights: Publications based on TÁRKI data collections should acknowledge those sources, primary investigators and depositors.
entry.dcterms:subject: TDATA-E63
Simultaneously with this survey, the first half of the Household Monitor 2001 (E63) was polled; the link between the two data files is made possible by the NDEGYEN variable.
SPSS portable datafile
other study-related materials:
Hungarian questionnaire
Hungarian documentation
English questionnaire
